title: A Costly Lesson in Chinese Business Practices
summary: Patrick Jenevein wanted to work with partners on wind energy. Instead he found himself in a yearslong contract dispute.. Patrick Jenevein was enthusiastic about doing business in China until he got burned. His company, Dallas-based Tang Energy Group, helped electrify China's impoverished western provinces in the 1990s. His company "actively supported China's bid for Most Favored Nation trading status with the U.S." and for membership in the World Trade Organization, his lawyers have noted, adding: "Scholars at the Council [on] Foreign Relations teased Jenevein about consistently seeing the best side of China. They were right."

title: Stretched Hospitals, Nursing Homes Fear Losing Staff Over Vaccine Rules
summary: Facilities that haven't required workers to get the shots say they will do so after the Supreme Court's ruling despite staffing concerns. Strained hospitals and nursing homes said they fear losing workers but would require Covid-19 vaccinations for employees after the Supreme Court allowed federal officials to mandate the shots in healthcare.

title: Senators Probe If Online Degrees Contribute to High Debt
summary: Lawmakers request information about companies' recruiting tactics and contracts with universities. Three U.S. senators sent a letter Friday to companies that develop online degree programs for universities, raising concerns about aggressive student-recruiting tactics and other policies that they said might contribute to rising college debt levels.

title: Supreme Court Blocks Biden Vaccine Rules for Private Employers, Allows Them for Healthcare Workers
summary: Justices allow Covid-19 vaccine mandate for healthcare workers whose facilities participate in Medicare and Medicaid. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court on Thursday blocked the Biden administration's Covid-19 vaccine-or-testing rules for large private employers, upending the government's most aggressive effort to combat the pandemic via the workplace.

title: What the Supreme Court's OSHA Ruling Means
summary: It weakens the legal basis for earlier efforts to protect workers from Covid, and it suggests other administrative 'work-arounds' will eventually fall. The Supreme Court's decision to stay the Labor Department's "vaccine or test" rule was a significant setback for the agency I once headed. It is also a vivid illustration of the difficulties ahead for President Biden's aggressive regulatory agenda.

title: Boris Johnson's Other Disaster
summary: His political woes are a warning to conservatives who indulge green-energy illusions.. Boris Johnson is fighting for political survival amid a scandal over parties during pandemic lockdowns in 2020. And if only that were the U.K. Prime Minister's only problem. "Party-gate" is proving so damaging because the news has landed on an electorate already exasperated with Mr. Johnson over soaring energy costs.

title: Who You Calling 'Dastardly,' Mr. Schumer?
summary: Another tall tale about Georgia voting proves too good to check.. Sen. Chuck Schumer is the latest politician to cite Georgia's election laws as a tool of voter suppression. "What motivated the insurrectionists" on Jan. 6, he told MSNBC, "is now motivating these state legislatures to do dastardly things." But these claims don't survive cursory inspection.

title: Fed Releases Transcripts of 2016 Policy Meetings
summary: Newly published records shed light on officials' debates over how fast to raise interest rates. Transcripts released by the Federal Reserve on Friday revealed the extent of officials' 2016 debate over how fast to move up interest rates after lifting them from near zero at the end of the previous year.

title: Navient, the Student Loan Punching Bag
summary: Politicians loot the company for helping for-profit schools.. The Democrats' government student loan takeover in 2010 is one of the great policy fiascoes of the age. But politicians can never admit it, so instead they're kicking Navient, the student loan servicer.

title: Jennifer Granholm's Green Brigade
summary: The Department of Energy launches a Clean Energy Corps.. These are boom times in Washington, as the executive branch is expanding to spend all the money Congress has bestowed in the last two years. For sheer enthusiasm, no one beats Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm, who unveiled her plan on Thursday for a federal Clean Energy Corps.

title: Don't Bail Out Putin
summary: His Ukraine gambit is ultimately about enlisting the West in a scheme to prop up his rule.. Good things come to strong, successful nations. Neighbors crave closer ties. Allies don't object to being part of a "sphere of influence." Vladimir Putin has given his neighboring peoples only reasons to run away from him. They wouldn't clamor for NATO membership if not for the kind of regime Mr. Putin operates.

title: Why the Chicago Teachers Union Always Gets What It Wants
summary: It can strike and ignore children because Illinois lawmakers give it extraordinary power.. Chicago

title: JPMorgan, Albertsons, Delta Air Lines: Stocks That Defined the Week
summary: Here are seven major companies whose stocks moved on the week's news. JPMorgan Chase & Co.

title: Dow Retreats as Bank Stocks Fall
summary: Major banks JPMorgan Chase and Citigroup post declining profits. The stock market's winter selloff deepened this week, pushing all three major indexes further into the red for 2022.

title: Russia Arrests Hackers Tied to Major U.S. Ransomware Attacks, Including Colonial Pipeline Disruption
summary: The group has been blamed for major attacks against U.S. businesses and infrastructure. WASHINGTON-The Russian government on Friday said it had arrested members of the prolific criminal ransomware group known as REvil that has been blamed for major attacks against U.S. business and critical infrastructure, disrupting its operations at the request of U.S. authorities.

title: What Russia's Arrest of REvil Hackers Means for Ransomware
summary: Russian security services arrested over a dozen suspected cybercriminals, aided by information shared by the U.S., senior official said. Russian authorities announced Friday that they raided one of the most prominent ransomware gangs, known as REvil, arrested 14 of its members and halted the group's operations at the request of the U.S. government.

title: Big Meat vs. Small Producers
summary: From beef to pork to poultry, a few massive companies extract as much profit as possible.. Regarding your editorial "Carving Up Biden's Inflation Beef" (Jan. 8): This isn't about covering higher costs or a lack of product, as the editorial claims. From beef to pork to poultry, the industry is dominated by a small number of massive companies that use their leverage to extract as much profit as possible-and it isn't trickling down to producers.

title: Sarah Bloom Raskin in Her Own Words
summary: The Fed nominee has said that the central bank shouldn't have purchased bonds of fossil-fuel companies as part of its pandemic emergency response. If Sarah Bloom Raskin is confirmed as the Federal Reserve's point person on banking oversight, the institution could be poised to make a more expansive effort to address financial risks caused by a warming environment.

title: Diplomacy, Not War, With Iran
summary: Opponents of the nuclear deal have some explaining to do.. Mark Dubowitz and Matthew Kroenig were wrong when they worked to undermine the highly successful nuclear agreement with Iran (JCPOA), and they are wrong now in pushing President Biden toward military conflict with Iran ("Biden's Moment of Truth in Iran," op-ed, Jan. 6). The JCPOA successfully prevented Iran from obtaining a nuclear bomb. Nuclear material was shipped out of the country, enrichment activities were restricted and inspectors were given unprecedented access to verify compliance. Messrs. Dubowitz, Kroenig and their allies fought to undo these achievements.

title: Netflix Raises Prices on U.S., Canada Plans
summary: The company's standard plan for U.S. users now costs $15.49 a month, up from $13.99. Netflix Inc. raised the price for its monthly plans, the first such increase from the streaming platform since 2020.

title: 'Sick!' by Earl Sweatshirt Review: A Cure for Processed Music
summary: The artist's latest album has a potent lyricism and a 'first take' aesthetic that suits the introspective nature of his rhyming..

title: Pianist Igor Levit at Carnegie Hall
summary: The Russian-German artist gave a concert that included the premiere of Fred Hersch's Variations on a Folksong..

title: In Berlin, Through the Glass Brightly
summary: Ludwig Mies van der Rohe's Neue Nationalgalerie upends the usual visitor experience in a design that champions modernism. Not every artist is fortunate enough to go out on a high, but Ludwig Mies van der Rohe did. His Neue Nationalgalerie in Berlin offers as thrilling a vision of his aspirations of structural expressiveness as can be found.

title: Retail Spending, Manufacturing Drop as Omicron and Inflation Surge
summary: Retail sales dropped 1.9% in December, a big slowdown at the holiday season's end; manufacturing output fell for first time since September. U.S. retail spending and manufacturing slowed at the end of 2021 as the Covid-19 Omicron variant and inflation surged, early signs the latest complications from the pandemic could be weighing on the economy.

title: BlackRock Now Manages Over $10 Trillion in Assets
summary: Money manager's profit rose 6% in fourth quarter. BlackRock Inc. posted higher quarterly profit, as market gains and new client money lifted the investment firm's assets under management above $10 trillion for the first time.

title: Afghanistan's Taliban Battle Rebellion by Ethnic Minority Fighters
summary: Some Uzbeks take up arms in the country's north, complaining of discrimination amid economic collapse. KABUL-Afghanistan's Taliban are battling a rebellion by ethnic minority fighters in their own ranks in the country's north, a sign that ties are fraying within the alliance built by the Islamist group that seized control of the country in August.

title: Martin Shkreli Banned for Life From Drug Industry
summary: Federal court finds imprisoned former executive engaged in monopolistic behavior. Martin Shkreli, who was widely criticized as "pharma bro" for raising the price of a lifesaving AIDS drug, was banned for life from the pharmaceutical industry Friday after a federal court found that the imprisoned former executive engaged in illegal and monopolistic behavior.

title: Google Misled Publishers and Advertisers, Lawsuit Alleges
summary: Details show Google employees fretting its ad tech auctions were 'untruthful' and based in 'insider information'. Google misled publishers and advertisers for years about the pricing and processes of its ad auctions, creating secret programs that deflated sales for some companies while increasing prices for buyers, according to newly unredacted allegations and details in a lawsuit by state attorneys general.

title: North Korea Fires Two Missiles After Angry Rant About U.S. Sanctions
summary: Pyongyang launches two suspected ballistic missiles in third weapons test of this year, South Korea's military says. SEOUL-North Korea conducted its third weapons test of the year, the military in Seoul said, shortly after Pyongyang issued a blistering response over new American sanctions on the Kim regime.

title: Wells Fargo's Quarterly Profit Soars 86%
summary: Bank's revenue up 13%; it released money set aside for pandemic loan losses. Wells Fargo & Co.'s profit soared 86% in the final three months of 2021.

title: Americans Can Order Free Rapid Covid-19 Tests From Website on Jan. 19
summary: Orders to be limited to four tests per residential address, will ship within 7-12 days after ordering, the White House says. The U.S. public can begin ordering free at-home rapid Covid-19 tests through a new government website on Jan. 19, senior Biden administration officials said.

title: Ohio Supreme Court Strikes Down New Congressional Map as Favoring GOP
summary: Court rules the new map violated a 2018 ballot measure to prevent gerrymandering. The Ohio Supreme Court struck down the state's new congressional district map, saying it violated the state Constitution by favoring Republicans.

title: Pandemic Profits Begin to Ebb at America's Biggest Banks
summary: Quarterly earnings fall at JPMorgan and Citigroup, ending what had been a streak of big gains. The tumultuous pandemic economy sent big-bank profits to great heights. They're coming back down to earth.

title: Citigroup's Quarterly Profit Falls 26%
summary: Investment banking fees jumped, but trading revenue fell. Citigroup Inc.'s fourth-quarter profit fell 26%, the bank said Friday.

title: Ancient Meteorite Doesn't Carry Evidence of Life on Mars, New Study Says
summary: Compounds found in 4-pound rock that crashed to Earth were formed by water, findings show. Evidence of life on Mars may still be out there-but the likelihood that proof is inside a 4-billion-year old meteorite that crashed to Earth decades ago just got slimmer.

title: Carbon Neutral (Saturday Crossword, January 15)

20 Books We Read This Week
summary: Everyday revolutionaries in 1776, the terrible aftermath of the Third Reich, wealth meets witchcraft in an alternate-reality London and much more..

title: Winter Storm System to Bring Snow to Midwest, Eastern U.S.
summary: Sections of Midwest under winter storm warning, with National Weather Service saying travel will likely be dangerous at times. Parts of the Midwest are expected to get several inches of snow starting Friday as a fast-moving winter storm system moves across the region and into the Mississippi Valley, the National Weather Service Weather Prediction Center said.

title: Chinese Regulator Flags a $50,000 Fine Against Walmart
summary: Local authorities highlight a 2021 infraction by U.S. retailer, latest in a series of criticisms. A local Chinese regulator and state media highlighted this week a roughly $50,000 fine Walmart Inc. paid last year, keeping a spotlight on the U.S. retailer at a time of rising political tensions between Beijing and Washington.

title: The Store-Brand Groceries You Actually Want
summary: Forget the utilitarian packaging and low-to-middling quality of decades past. Store brands have gone upmarket. FOR MOST of its nondescript life, the humble store brand has played the role of poor cousin to more glamorous brand-name products. Its packaging was basic, even ugly; the quality, good enough. From cereal to cookies to canned beans, the store-brand product's main allure was its bargain price.

title: Biden Taps Economists Cook, Jefferson for Fed Seats
summary: If confirmed by Senate, Jefferson and Cook would be fourth and fifth Black governors to serve on Fed's board in its 109-year history. President Biden will seek to fill two seats on the Federal Reserve's Board of Governors with academic economists Lisa Cook of Michigan State University and Philip Jefferson of Davidson College, the White House said Thursday.

title: Francis Bacon Painted the Human Animal
summary: A new exhibition shows how the British artist saw humanity's bestial side. Francis Bacon spent the first 16 years of his life growing up on a stud farm in Ireland surrounded by horses and dogs. For Bacon, an asthmatic, danger lurked in animal fur, and forever after the British artist professed to hate the countryside. "He must have been both attracted and repelled," says Michael Peppiatt, the lead curator of "Francis Bacon: Man and Beast," a new exhibition opening on Jan. 29 at the Royal Academy of Arts in London.

title: 'Undercover Billionaire' Star Grant Cardone Pays $40 Million for Malibu Home
summary: The seller of the Carbon Beach property was businessman Vadim Shulman. "Undercover Billionaire" star Grant Cardone is undercover no more. The entrepreneur and motivational speaker said he has bought a $40 million house in the Malibu, Calif., neighborhood known as "Billionaires' Beach."

title: 'Smart City' Chattanooga Names a New CIO
summary: Tyson Morris will succeed Brent Messer in the Tennessee city-which has a 10-gigabit network. 'I'm getting the keys to a very fast car,' Morris says. Chattanooga, one of the first cities in the country to host a gigabit-speed network, is getting a new chief information officer.

title: A Montecito Property, Vacant Except for Century-Old Ruins, Lists for $78 Million
summary: Montecito's roughly 330-acre Mar Y Cel is one of the largest undeveloped properties in the area. In the foothills above Montecito, Calif., a roughly 330-acre property with the remains of an amphitheater and stone aqueducts is hitting the market for $78 million.

title: GOP Rep. John Katko, Who Voted to Impeach Trump, to Leave Congress
summary: New York lawmaker had worked with Democrats to try to establish bipartisan Jan. 6 commission. Rep. John Katko, a moderate Republican who voted to impeach former President Donald Trump following the Jan. 6 riot at the Capitol, said he wouldn't seek another term in office.

title: Howard and Grazer's Imagine Entertainment in Talks to Sell Stake
summary: London-based Centricus is in talks to purchase more than 70% of Imagine, known for movies such as 'Apollo 13' and 'Cinderella Man'. Imagine Entertainment, the film and TV production company co-founded by Ron Howard and Brian Grazer, is in talks to sell a majority stake to Centricus, a London-based investment firm, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Arizona Could See Clawback of Coronavirus Relief Funds Over Mask Rules, Treasury Says
summary: State could lose federal aid if it doesn't redesign two programs established with the money. Arizona could see a clawback of federal coronavirus relief funds if the state doesn't redesign two educational programs that the federal government says undermine the use of masks in schools, the Treasury Department said in a letter to the state Friday.

title: White House Says Russia Planning 'False Flag' Operation as Pretext for Invading Ukraine
summary: Press secretary Jen Psaki says U.S. sees signs invasion could come in matter of weeks. WASHINGTON-Russia has deployed operatives to undertake a "false flag" operation in eastern Ukraine that would fabricate a pretext for invading the country, the White House said Friday, warning it saw signs an invasion could come in a matter of weeks.

title: AT&T, Dish Spend Billions on Spectrum for 5G Services
summary: Federal Communications Commission's most recent auction of wireless spectrum licenses will require military cooperation. AT&T Inc. and Dish Network Corp. topped the list of bidders for a swath of wireless spectrum previously reserved for military use, offering a new test for telecom companies seeking to share the air with other users.

title: Biden Moves to Remake the Federal Reserve
summary: Latest nominees include former regulator, academic economists. President Biden's flurry of recent picks to the Federal Reserve's Board of Governors would shape the central bank's leadership for years to come. They also would bring unprecedented diversity to the 108-year-old institution. If Mr. Biden's five nominees are confirmed by the Senate, the seven-member board would include-for the first time-four women and two Black governors.

title: How Men's Hype Bags Became the New Sneakers
summary: Once a punchline, men's cross-body bags by brands like Gucci and Off-White have emerged as must-have status accessories, eliminating back-pocket bulges and any outdated stigma in convenient, hands-free ways.. ONE MORNING last October, Maynard Villaflores, 24, set his alarm for 5:55 a.m. Snoozing was not an option: At 6 a.m., New York brand Telfar was dropping a limited number of its coveted unisex handbags online. "Within two minutes the bags [would] be sold out," said Mr. Villaflores, a social-media manager in Portland, Ore. He snapped up a mini olive number that he now wears across his chest. "The rush and [hype around the drop] reminds me of buying Jordans," he said.

title: Walmart Shuffles Executives, Names New Merchandising Chief
summary: Retail giant says chief customer officer Janey Whiteside is leaving. Walmart Inc. is shuffling top executives as the retail behemoth works to keep its pandemic growth streak alive and move faster to build its online business.

title: Fed Pick Raskin Faces Some Heat in Confirmation
summary: Raskin's stances on climate change may draw pushback on bank regulatory post. WASHINGTON-Sarah Bloom Raskin, President Biden's pick to become the Fed's top banking regulator, could face a contentious nomination process due to her support for tougher banking rules and for using financial regulation to address climate-change positions cheered by progressives but criticized by some Republicans.

title: Stop Reading This Lousy Column, and Read a Book Instead
summary: Americans are reading fewer books. Here's how to reverse a worrisome trend.. A bit of distressing news: Americans are reading fewer books. At least that's the report from the gang at Gallup, who surveyed U.S. adults in December 2021 and learned that we're all individually reading "roughly two or three fewer books per year" than we did in 2001-16.

title: Biden Crosses the Quinnipiac
summary: Did the president finally admit that his claims about states preventing people from voting are false?. As America approaches the end of the first year of the Biden presidency-or as Democrats describe it, the era of greed-the White House is arguing that Mr. Biden's recent polling numbers aren't as bad as they seem. More consequentially, the president appears to have just admitted that state voting laws aren't as bad as he often claims.

title: Ashton Kutcher and Mila Kunis Sell Beverly Hills Home for $10.35 Million

summary: The state's surgeon general, Joseph Ladapo, on his advice against tests for the asymptomatic, his opposition to vaccination mandates, and life in Los Angeles under lockdown.. Clearwater, Fla.

title: 'Architects of an American Landscape' Review: Genius by Design
summary: In the 19th century, American architects were expected to follow European trends. Henry Hobson Richardson begged to differ.. Anumber of years ago, author Hugh Howard told the editor at his publishing house that he wanted to resurrect the reputation of Henry Hobson Richardson, "the most admired architect of his era." But if no one has heard of Richardson, his editor replied, who is going to buy your book?

title: Energy Crunch Hammers French Nuclear Giant EDF
summary: Shares in EDF take one of their biggest tumbles on record after France blocked the utility from fully passing on soaring energy prices to consumers. A decision by the French government to force electricity giant Électricité de France SA to eat higher energy prices slammed the company's shares, making the state-controlled utility a high-profile victim of Europe's energy crisis.

title: Can Politics Get Better When Higher Education Keeps Getting Worse?
summary: Voters have the sense to resist notions like critical race theory. A generation from now, they may not.. Only a few years ago, several well-established features of the current political landscape were too absurd to be taken seriously. Defunding the police was a ridiculous idea; critical race theory would be a giant step backward in race relations; leftist radicalism was a fringe element of the Democratic Party. Suddenly all have gone mainstream.

title: Prince Andrew: Who Is the Duke of York and Why Is He in the News?
summary: Queen Elizabeth stripped Prince Andrew of his military affiliations and patronages, as Buckingham Palace seeks distance itself from sexual-abuse allegations. Britain's Prince Andrew is in the spotlight over his ties to disgraced financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The prince is currently embroiled in a legal battle in New York amid allegations that he sexually abused a teenager who was introduced to him by Epstein in the early 2000s. He denies the allegations.

title: The Climate Challenge After Glasgow Summit: Making Good on Promises
summary: Countries and companies are on the line for bold action to curb greenhouse-gas emissions, but political and economic hurdles are making that harder. World leaders made a lot of bold pledges to curb greenhouse-gas emissions at the Glasgow climate conference in November. Now, countries and companies face the prospect of making good on those promises, in the face of political and economic headwinds.

title: Squabbling Heirs Rock Former Texas Governor's Ranching Empire
summary: Resume Subscription. UVALDE, Texas-In a family photograph taken in 1958, future Texas Gov. Dolph Briscoe Jr., wearing a starched white cowboy shirt, is pictured with his wife and three young children in front of their wooden ranch house, surrounded by Briscoe land as far as the eye can see.

title: Boeing Engineer Who Oversaw 737 MAX Design to Retire
summary: Michael Teal was chief engineer during 737 MAX's development before two of the jets crashed. A senior Boeing Co. engineer who oversaw the design of the 737 MAX is retiring from the plane maker, the company said Friday.

title: Village Roadshow, Producer on 'Joker' and 'The Matrix,' Explores Strategic Options
summary: Film-and-TV financier has tapped investment bank PJT to explore variety of options and has considered a sale. Village Roadshow Entertainment Group, a film-and-television financier with a deep library of content, is exploring strategic options including taking on a significant investment or selling itself, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: A California Home Asking $27.45 Million Could Set a Record-Again
summary: Resume Subscription. A $27.45 million home is hitting the market in Hidden Hills, Calif., making it the most expensive listing in the city, according to listing agent Tomer Fridman of the Fridman Group at Compass.

title: Olympic Bobsledder Elana Meyers Taylor Is Vying for the Gold
summary: After winning bronze and silver medals in past Olympics, the 37-year-old athlete heads to Beijing amid the challenges of motherhood and the pandemic. A bobsled can whip around hairpin turns at over 90 miles an hour, but for Elana Meyers Taylor, a triple Olympic medalist, the most invigorating moment of a race is just before it begins. "I love the feeling that anything can happen," she explains over the phone from Winterberg, Germany, fresh off winning a couple of gold medals in the sport's World Cup. She adds that this electric sense of potential is especially powerful in the Olympics: "At that point you know you made it to the games and there's no champion yet," she says. "Just taking a breath, taking it all in, that's the moment I live for."

title: U.A.E. Invests $100 Million in Israel's Tech Sector as Countries Get Closer
summary: A year and a half since the deal that normalized ties between Israel and the U.A.E., business is taking off. A major United Arab Emirates sovereign-wealth fund has invested roughly $100 million in venture-capital firms in Israel's technology sector, according to people familiar with the investments, a fresh sign of deepening business and investment ties between the countries at the forefront of the Abraham Accords.

title: Bank Investors Must Wait for the Benefits of Rising Interest Rates
summary: JPMorgan is poised to benefit from rate increases, but for now still faces headwinds in areas such as credit cards and expenses. Rising interest rates are going to be good for banks. Someday.

title: U.S. Will Spend $27 Billion to Repair Bridges
summary: States will be awarded funds based on need, with California slated to get $4.2 billion. WASHINGTON-The Biden administration on Friday announced more than $27 billion in spending over the next five years to repair dilapidated bridges across the country, including full funding for structures that aren't part of the federal highway system.

title: Democrats Explore Changes for Child Tax Credit to Win Manchin's Favor
summary: Party considering scaling back size of expansion or narrowing number of families eligible for benefit. WASHINGTON-Some Democrats have started exploring how to pare back their proposed expansion of the child tax credit in ways that are aimed at winning the critical support of Sen. Joe Manchin (D., W.Va.), according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Shadow of Prince Andrew Scandal Looms Over Buckingham Palace
summary: As Britain's monarchy seeks to insulate itself from the Jeffrey Epstein scandal, it may prove difficult to distance from Queen Elizabeth's second son. On Thursday, British tabloids published a grainy photograph of Prince Andrew riding in the back of a Range Rover on his way to see his mother, Queen Elizabeth.

title: Prosecutors Recommend Dropping Case Against MIT Scientist Over China Ties
summary: Possible reversal comes as Justice Department reviews its initiative to counter Chinese government activities in U.S.. WASHINGTON-Federal prosecutors have recommended that the Justice Department drop criminal charges against a Massachusetts Institute of Technology mechanical engineering professor accused of hiding his China ties, according to people familiar with the matter, as the Biden administration reviews an effort to counter Chinese influence at U.S. universities.

title: It Will Take Time to Dig Out of This Consumer-Spending Hole
summary: With Omicron, it seems all but certain the economy will grow at a much slower pace in the first quarter. Consumer spending ended last year on a down note. And with Covid-19 cases rising sharply, the risk is that it will weaken further.

title: Ukraine Government Websites Hit by Cyberattack
summary: Hack on ministry sites comes as Russia moves more troops near Ukraine and talks with West stall. Ukraine said it was targeted by a massive cyberattack, amid a growing buildup of Russian troops and military equipment around its borders.

title: Team USA Advises Athletes Heading to Beijing Olympics to Leave Their Phones at Home
summary: The U.S. joins Great Britain, Canada, the Netherlands in taking precautions against being monitored through technology. American athletes heading to Beijing for the Winter Olympics could find themselves without their most familiar equipment: their cellphones.

title: Iran Seeks Closer Ties With China as Nuclear Talks Drag On
summary: Iran's foreign minister is in China to discuss a wide-ranging economic and security agreement. As talks between Iran, the U.S. and other world powers to revive the 2015 nuclear deal continue, the Islamic Republic is trying to strengthen ties with China, Russia and other nations that could help it get around American sanctions that are battering its economy.

title: Making Ricotta at Home Is Easy, and the Key to So Many Delicious Meals
summary: Both the curds and the whey of this fresh cheese provide the basis for countless comforting winter recipes, from remarkably tender meatballs to a warming butternut-squash soup. I'VE BEEN teaching cooking classes for about a decade, and one of my favorites is cheesemaking. In the most basic class we start with the simplest cheese, ricotta. Seeing it come together for the first time invariably inspires an audible reaction, often an "Oh, wow." Liquid turns into solid, right in front of your eyes. It's science, but it sure does look like magic.

title: 'Liberty is Sweet' Review: Unsung Heroes
summary: A focus on unhappy farmers and Native Americans, not the 'maudlin musings' of the Founders.. When the American Revolution ended, John Adams despaired that an accurate history of it would ever be written. "The Essence of the whole will be that Dr Franklins electrical Rod, smote the Earth and out Spring General Washington," he wrote in 1790, ". . . and thence forward these two conducted all the Policy Negotiations Legislation and War."

title: Mysteries: 'My Annihilation' Review
summary: Fuminori Nakamura's thriller is a maze in which memories are erased and buried traumas emerge.. 'Turn this page," warns the first sentence of "My Annihilation," the latest psychological thriller by Fuminori Nakamura, "and you may give up your entire life." The undaunted reader is soon immersed in a disturbing first-person account (memoir? confession? case study?) of one Ryodai Kozuka, a man terrorized by recollections of his traumatic childhood and its transgressive impulses.

title: The Putin Puzzle: Why Ukraine? Why Now?
summary: Even dictators have domestic political considerations, and Putin has a long history of using an aggressive foreign policy to bolster his standing in Russia.. For the last several months, Russia has been amassing troops, now numbering an estimated 100,000, along its extensive border with Ukraine. Moscow's hostile intentions toward its neighbor have been clear since the winter of 2014, when Ukraine's "Revolution of Dignity" ousted the country's corrupt Kremlin-backed president and turned Kyiv resolutely toward democracy and the European Union. Russia's response then was to seize and annex Ukraine's Crimean peninsula and to invade the eastern Ukrainian region of Donbas. Today's mobilization has all the markings of an encore.

title: McDonald's CEO Confronts a Supersized Challenge
summary: Chris Kempczinski is navigating the pandemic's upheaval, political issues; seeking an alternative to 'the "billions and billions served" experience'. CHICAGO-McDonald's Corp. Chief Executive Chris Kempczinski is starting the year at the helm of one of the world's most recognizable restaurant brands battling the latest coronavirus variant, rising inflation and workforce shortages.

title: 'Eight Days in May' and 'Aftermath' Review: Surviving the Time of Wolves
summary: In the wake of the Allied victory, loyalists to the Reich lashed out, while surviving elites scrambled to adapt.. "Eight Days in May," a gripping, immaculately researched retelling of the Nazi Götterdämmerung, is the story of an intermission, a phase, as the German author Erich Kästner wrote in his diary, between the "no longer" and "not yet." But during this intermission the action rarely paused. Written by Volker Ullrich, a German journalist and historian perhaps best known for his impressive two-volume biography of Hitler, this book is structured as the day-by-day chronicle implied by its title. That said, Mr. Ullrich also looks further backward and forward in time to add the context that a study confined to eight days alone could not provide.

title: How a Flood of Money Swamped Cathie Wood's ARK
summary: The ARK Innovation ETF posted big returns, and big money followed. Now it's the latest example of what happens when a fund becomes too large for its own good.. Fund manager Cathie Wood became a superstar in 2020, after her ARK exchange-traded funds earned some of the highest returns in history.

title: 'The Unseen Body' Review: Internal Affairs
summary: The brain and heart may have pride of place, but our various organs have unique and surprising roles to play in keeping us alive.. This past Christmas, our family had a superspreader event. We were all vaccinated, most of us triply so, and all of us tested negative the day of our gathering. Yet few of us escaped Covid.

title: 'The Original Bambi' Review: Afterlife of a Fawn
summary: A fresh translation of a classic tale restores the author's original vision.. In 1922, readers of the Viennese newspaper Neue Freie Presse began following the serialized tale of a young roebuck and his allegorical woodland experiences. Written by the Jewish Austro-Hungarian journalist Felix Salten, the story-installments followed the deer, Bambi, from an infant state of perfect innocence through his initiation into the hard facts of forest life. He learns that nature is red in tooth and claw; that winter inflicts privation; that Man is a predator who corrupts, enslaves and kills. To survive, Bambi comes to understand that he must live alone, cut off from others.

title: Fiction: Kevin Honold's 'Molly'
summary: An unlikely pair are thrown together in the New Mexican desert in 'Molly.'. Three miles from the remote New Mexico town of Santa Juana de Arco is a mesa, Kevin Honold writes in his novel "Molly," and on that mesa there is a trailer where a 9-year-old boy named Raymond has been sent to live with his uncle Edward. It is 1968-Raymond is recalling events from the contemplative distance of adulthood-but not much of world affairs have penetrated the mountains. Raymond's education comes by way of a handful of adults, a few books from a mobile library and the wordless tutelage of the natural world. He is alone but not unhappy, since, he reflects, "the loneliness of childhood has this quality: it is visionary. Childhood confers a measure of neutrality that allows the child to wander freely between two worlds." There is no border between the wonders of the landscape and his imagination.

title: 'Emotional' Review: More Than a Feeling
summary: Like humans, animals have emotions. Could machines develop them too?. In high school and college, I learned calculus. I loved the material, but have not had much use for it in my personal or professional life. Meanwhile, I never received practical instruction in the calculus of the emotions-how they function, where they derive from, when to integrate them with reason and logic, and in what manner. That's a loss, because emotional intelligence is critical to success in nearly every domain.

title: 'Blank Pages and Other Stories' Review: A Grand Belfast Accent
summary: In Bernard MacLaverty's fiction, powerful emotions surge through even the quietest lives.. Bernard MacLaverty's short stories and novels flow as easily as conversation but writing them is painstaking. "At the age of 79 I still find it is very difficult to write," Mr. MacLaverty said last month. "Everything has to be exact . . . You just can't scribble off a line."

title: RNC Threatens Boycott of Commission-Planned Debates
summary: Trump and some other Republicans have alleged bias on the part of general election debate organizers. The Republican National Committee is threatening to prohibit its future presidential nominees from participating in general election debates sponsored by a commission that has been the official organizer of such events for more than three decades as it sought to address grievances leveled by former President Donald Trump and others in the party.

title: Science Fiction: Charles Stross's 'Quantum of Nightmares'
summary: In an alternate-reality England, the superwealthy have supernatural powers.. Magic London is a popular scenario for fantasy authors, from Neil Gaiman's "Neverwhere" and China Miéville's "Un Lun Dun" to Ben Aaronovitch's "Rivers of London" and V.E. Schwab's "A Darker Shade of Magic." Part of the charm is the combination of mythology and modernity: old gods, strange wights, Boadicea and the Tower, all mixed in with tech startups and hedge-fund billionaires.

title: Google Doubles Down on the Office, Buying London Site for $1 Billion
summary: Tech giant says it is confident in the future of the physical workplace. LONDON-Google plans to spend $1 billion buying office space it already uses in central London, saying it believes office work will remain vital for the tech giant.

title: Five Best: Books on Show Business Behind the Scenes
summary: Selected by Celia Imrie, the author, most recently, of the novel 'Orphans of the Storm.'. By Gavin Lambert (1963)

title: Musk Says Tesla Is Accepting Dogecoin for Some Purchases
summary: The company now is pricing some merchandise in the digital currency, though not vehicles. Elon Musk said Tesla Inc. is accepting payment for some merchandise with dogecoin, a return for the electric-vehicle maker to acceptance of digital currencies for some payments.

title: China to Tighten Rules Over Casinos in Macau
summary: Bill would cut the tenure for new casino licenses in half and require operations to align with China's national security needs. Macau released a new draft law that would cut the tenure for new casino licenses in half and require operations to align with China's national security needs, but wouldn't reduce the number of licenses in the lucrative gambling hub.

title: Stock Picking Drives Back to the Future
summary: How to make money in e-commerce right now? Try good ol' fashioned math.. Losing money in the stock market? Take Doc Brown's DeLorean for a spin.

title: Russia Moves More Weaponry Toward Ukraine, Keeps the West Guessing
summary: Tanks, missile launchers and other materiel are seen being shifted westward from bases in the Russian Far East. WASHINGTON-As diplomats were holding negotiations over the Ukraine crisis this week, Russia began moving tanks, infantry fighting vehicles, rocket launchers and other military equipment westward from their bases in its Far East, according to U.S. officials and social-media reports.

title: The Quest to Identify a Westerner Called 'The Most Famous Face in China'
summary: The thin, gray-bearded man featured in Chinese mattress ads world-wide carried no name, drawing curiosity, theories-and a surprising denouement. HONG KONG-Sam Voutas, an Australian writer and filmmaker, remembers clearly the first time he saw the billboard in China a decade ago: A Steve Jobs look-alike with a quizzical expression touting a luminous white mattress. The brand was De Rucci, and the slogan read: "Sleep system. Healthy sleep."

title: An Endemic Pandemic Can Also Make Airlines Symptomatic
summary: Delta Air Lines' latest outlook confirms Omicron probably won't derail travel recovery, but recurrent Covid-19 setbacks still bad news for carriers. Airline investors are hoping that this pandemic turns endemic, but that could come with some nasty symptoms, too.

title: 'Toolbox Lady' Expanded Manufacturer Founded by Husband
summary: Gertrude Danziger, who has died at age 102, led Homak, a maker of gun cabinets and other hardware. At hardware trade shows, Gertrude S. Danziger stood out as a rare female chief executive of a metal-fabricating company. Her Chicago-based Homak Manufacturing Co. made toolboxes, gun cabinets and hospital carts. She was sometimes called the Toolbox Lady.

title: European Union Faces External and Internal Rifts
summary: The bloc's collective response to Covid only pushed its problems into the future, or papered over them. BRUSSELS-Once again, a new year begins under the shadow of Covid-19, and once again Europe is struggling to achieve cohesion and durable economic growth while grappling with the pandemic.

title: Russia Signals Impatience With U.S. Over Ukraine Tensions
summary: Foreign minister says Russia won't wait forever for a response to its demands. MOSCOW-Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov warned that Moscow is running out of patience with the U.S. and pressed Washington for a response to its demands that the West stop encroaching on what the Kremlin views as its traditional sphere of influence.

title: Dogecoin, Citigroup, Novavax, Las Vegas Sands: What to Watch in the Stock Market Today
summary: Tesla made some of its merchandise available for purchase with dogecoin; Major bank earnings are rolling in. Wall Street stock indexes slipped in morning trading after the first wave of major bank earnings of the season. Here's what we're watching in Friday's trading:

title: After Scramble to Replace NHL Players, USA Hockey Reveals Men's Olympic Team
summary: Collegians make up the majority of the American roster after the NHL declined to send players to Beijing in December. Team USA will look a little different than planned at the Beijing Olympics.

title: West Virginia Gov. Jim Justice Feeling Better After Covid-19
summary: 'Without question, the fact that I chose to get vaccinated and boosted saved my life,' the Republican governor said. West Virginia Gov. Jim Justice says his health is improving after he tested positive for Covid-19 earlier this week and felt "extremely unwell."

title: Australia Cancels Djokovic's Visa Again
summary: Immigration chief says decision is in the public interest. SYDNEY-Australia canceled Novak Djokovic's visa for a second time, just days before the World's No. 1 men's tennis player is scheduled to appear in the Australian Open.

title: Elon Musk-Backed EV Battery Technology Rises to Dominance in China
summary: Tesla, Chinese makers take lead over rivals in using less-expensive iron in place of nickel. A less-expensive battery technology championed by Tesla Inc.'s Elon Musk rose to dominate the world's largest auto market last year, pointing to challenges for Tesla's U.S. and European rivals.

title: Covid-19 Cases Keep Up Pressure on U.S. Hospitals
summary: Seven-day average for hospitalizations reaches a record, reflecting the severity of the Omicron wave. A surge in Covid-19 cases continued to test hospitals in the U.S. amid signs that a wave of infections fueled by the Omicron variant has peaked in other parts of the world.

title: The 3G Shutdown Is Coming-Here's How That Affects You
summary: AT&T, Verizon and T-Mobile will put down 3G for good this year. Even if you don't have a 3G phone anymore (and chances are you don't), the technology most certainly changed your life.

title: Tom Brady Tackled These Guys. They Still Can't Believe It.
summary: He has won seven Super Bowls and broken the all-time passing records. He also has 13 tackles and shocked the people he brought down.. Nate Clements remembers exactly what he was thinking as he raced down the sidelines with the football back in 2004. The former Buffalo Bills cornerback picked off a pass, ran 35 yards and there was only one person with a chance at stopping him from returning it for a touchdown.

title: Crypto Exchange FTX Sets Up $2 Billion Venture Fund
summary: FTX Ventures will invest in crypto startups across sectors. Crypto exchange FTX Trading Ltd. has launched a $2 billion venture fund, one of the largest vehicles to date aiming to tap into the crypto market's startups.

title: U.S. Embassy, Civilian Targets Attacked in Iraq
summary: Attacks threaten a new era of violence as the country tries to form a new government. BAGHDAD-Rockets targeted the U.S. Embassy in Baghdad and men on motorcycles hurled grenades at the offices of political rivals of Iran-backed militias, threatening a new spiral of violence as Iraq moves to form a new government following last year's parliamentary election.

title: German Slowdown Sends Global Warning Signs
summary: A bellwether of global growth, the German economy slowed sharply at the end of 2021. FRANKFURT-Germany's economy hit the brakes at the end of last year as the export powerhouse was slammed by global supply-chain bottlenecks, surging material prices and weakness in its biggest trading partner, China.

title: NineDot Lands Carlyle Investment for New York Battery Projects
summary: Private-equity firm spent over $100 million on separate investments as it expands into the market for large-scale electricity storage. David Arfin, a pioneer of rooftop solar power in the U.S., is developing a dozen basketball court-sized electric battery sites in New York City with a recent investment from Carlyle Group Inc.

title: Tech Selloff Pushes Ex-Unicorn Bonds Into Distressed Hands
summary: Distressed-credit funds are eyeing the discounted debt of some prominent tech companies that have seen their stock prices decline. Distressed-debt funds have been purchasing discounted convertible bonds issued by technology companies after a broad sector selloff, sometimes reaping double-digit yields in an otherwise benign credit market characterized by low defaults and accommodative lenders.

title: Vaccine Makers Seek Omicron Shots That Health Officials Say Might Not Be Needed
summary: Industry executives foresee eventual demand for tailored doses, but U.S. officials say current evidence doesn't support rolling them out and cite practical reasons not to. As Covid-19 vaccine makers prepare Omicron-specific shots, federal health authorities say there are signs they might not be necessary.

title: Nike and Adidas Are Dipping Toes Into the NFT Market. The Sneakerheads Are Into It.
summary: Virtual shoes don't weigh apparel brands down with inventory or supply-chain snags. They do come with other risks, though.. Non-fungible tokens, or NFTs, are a lot like sneaker drops: They come in limited quantities, depend on sky-high demand and stir speculative crazes in the resale market. It should come as no surprise, then, that Nike , Adidas and Under Armour have dipped their toes into the market. Can they hit the ground running?

title: Expedia Says Its Super Bowl Ads Are 'Vote of Confidence' in Travel Sector
summary: Company aims to use Super Bowl commercial for Expedia and pregame ad for Vrbo to reintroduce brands that are 'a little bit dusty'. Expedia Group Inc. is advertising in the Super Bowl as the travel industry hopes for a more robust rebound and the company seeks to breathe new life into its brands.

title: A Closer Look
summary: Selections from 'The Original Bambi' by Felix Salten, illustrated by Alenka Sottler. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Walgreens, CVS Shut Some Pharmacies on Weekends as Omicron Strains Staffing
summary: From Akron, Ohio, to New Gloucester, Maine, drugstore chains are temporarily closing understaffed locations. The biggest U.S. drugstore chains are shutting some pharmacies on weekends as the spread of Covid-19 and the Omicron variant exacerbates already severe staffing shortages.

title: China Bans Flights From U.S. as Covid-19 Measures Intensify
summary: Flight bans shut off access to country ahead of the Lunar New Year and the Winter Olympics. HONG KONG-Chinese aviation authorities ordered more flights from the U.S. canceled for the coming weeks, along with flights from countries including France, Indonesia and the United Arab Emirates, citing Covid-19 containment rules.

title: How Covid-19 Has Widened the Gap Between Rich and Poor Countries
summary: Progress in bridging the economic divide between developed and developing nations has been set back by the Covid-19 pandemic. The Covid-19 pandemic is widening the gap between rich and poor countries, a trend that threatens to reverse years of economic progress and set back efforts to alleviate global poverty.

title: Hedge Funds Keyed to Growth Stocks Stall Out
summary: After a profitable run, their performance in 2021 was the worst in years. A major bright spot for the hedge-fund industry in recent years has suddenly darkened as stocks of technology and other fast-growing companies sell off, handing out large losses to some big investors.

title: For Remote Workers, the Sick Day Is Over
summary: Resume Subscription. It's been said that remote schooling effectively killed the snow day. For Americans working from home, the latest coronavirus variant has meant the end of the sick day.

title: Bond Market Forecasts Bad Economic News
summary: Resume Subscription. With the best job growth in over 40 years, inflation a national obsession and the Federal Reserve preparing to raise interest rates, it is easy to forget how different the world was before the pandemic. The global environment then was marked by sluggish growth, lackluster investment, worryingly low inflation and low interest rates.

title: Democrats Face Costs of Rising Inflation With Few Options Left
summary: Rapidly rising prices have spurred politicians to explore for the first time in years how much leverage they have. WASHINGTON-Democrats are trying to use their control of Congress and the White House to curb inflation that has taken off on their watch, but economists say price increases have reached a point beyond what any political party can easily do to tame them quickly.

title: South Korea Raises Rate Back to Pre-Pandemic Level
summary: Central bank increases benchmark seven-day repurchase rate by 0.25 percentage point to 1.25%. South Korea raised interest rates to their pre-pandemic level to fight inflation and signaled that more increases could be coming later in the year.

title: China's Export Machine Notches New Record as Pandemic Grinds On
summary: The world's second-largest economy cemented its place as the world's factory floor last year, even as relations with the West grew more tense. HONG KONG-China's export boom took the country's trade surplus to a record in 2021, as its manufacturing prowess and surging global demand beat headwinds including rising geopolitical tensions with the Western world.

title: Chinese Bad-Debt Manager Cinda Backs Out of Ant Unit's Capital Raise
summary: China's big four 'bad banks' are experiencing volatile times. HONG KONG-China Cinda Asset Management Co., a state-owned financial institution, is pulling out of a planned large investment in the consumer-finance arm of Jack Ma's Ant Group Co., dealing a setback to the fintech giant's lending-business revamp.

title: China Evergrande Averts First Onshore Public Default
summary: Troubled developer's domestic bondholders agree to six-month reprieve. China Evergrande Group secured investor backing to delay making payments on a $708 million onshore bond denominated in Chinese yuan, avoiding what could have been its first public default in the country's domestic bond market.

title: Citigroup Exits More Asian Consumer-Banking Operations With $3.7 Billion Deal
summary: Singapore's UOB will pay $690 million premium for regional businesses. Citigroup Inc. agreed to sell its consumer-banking franchises in Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand and Vietnam to United Overseas Bank Ltd. , advancing its strategy to exit most of its retail operations in Asia and free up resources to deploy in wealth management and in serving corporate customers.

summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Biden Dealt Setback on Elections Bill, Filibuster
summary: Democratic Sen. Kyrsten Sinema again voiced her opposition to weakening the filibuster. WASHINGTON-President Biden expressed doubts that Democrats would pass their elections legislation, bowing to political realities that left party leaders shy of any path forward in the Senate, just two days after he cited a grave threat to democracy in imploring lawmakers to approve the measure.

title: Senate Rejects Nord Stream 2 Sanctions Bill
summary: White House opposes proposal by GOP Sen. Ted Cruz, backs other bill. WASHINGTON-The Senate voted Thursday to defeat a bill sponsored by Sen. Ted Cruz (R., Texas) that would have imposed sanctions on Nord Stream 2 AG, the company behind a pipeline built to deliver Russian natural gas to Germany.

title: Biden Will Nominate Raskin as Top Fed Banking Regulator
summary: Former No. 2 Treasury official has called for more aggressive climate focus. President Biden will nominate Sarah Bloom Raskin, a former top Treasury Department official, to serve as the Federal Reserve's top banking regulator, the White House said.

title: Jan. 6 Panel Subpoenas Reddit, Twitter and Parent Companies of Google and Facebook
summary: Committee says that the social-media companies' responses to prior requests for information were inadequate. The House select committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the U.S. Capitol issued subpoenas to four social-media companies as part of its investigation into the riot and its causes.

title: Eye-Care Company Bausch & Lomb Files for IPO
summary: Bausch Health Cos. said in 2020 that it planned to spin off the eye-care business. Bausch & Lomb Corp. has filed paperwork for its initial public offering, nearly a year and half after its parent company, Bausch Health Cos., said it would spin off the eye-care company.

title: With Biden Mandate Blocked, Many Companies Won't Impose Covid-19 Vaccine Rules
summary: Some corporate leaders applauded the Supreme Court's rejection of the mandate. Several corporate leaders said they would scrap plans to impose vaccine requirements for their workers after the Supreme Court blocked the Biden administration's mandate for large private employers. Others said they would move ahead with their plans to require shots.

title: Monster Beverage Buys Owner of Craft Breweries Cigar City, Oskar Blues for $330 Million
summary: Energy-drink maker enters beer, hard-seltzer business with purchase of CANarchy Craft Brewery Collective. Monster Beverage Corp. has been mulling a move into booze for years. It finally took the plunge Thursday, becoming the latest big soft-drink company to try its hand at alcoholic beverages.

title: Fed's Waller Says High Inflation Caught Central Bank Off Guard
summary: Central bank official says three interest-rate increases this year are an appropriate baseline. A Federal Reserve official warned that the central bank would have to move interest rates up more aggressively this year if inflation stays high through the first half of the year.

title: Truckers Fret Over Pending Covid-19 Vaccine Rules at U.S.-Canada Border
summary: On Saturday, Canada will require American and other foreign truckers to be fully vaccinated to enter, with similar U.S. rules coming Jan. 22. Truckers expect new snarls and further difficulties finding drivers. OTTAWA-Trucking companies and manufacturers say new Covid-19 vaccine mandates set to take effect at the U.S.-Canada border could upend an already fragile logistics network.
